content:
Dudley wants to get in shape. He plans to burn $2000$ calories every week using a combination of the elliptical and the bike machine. The elliptical burns $500$ calories per hour, and the bike machine burns $400$ calories per hour. 

**Write an *inequality* that represents the number of hours Dudley must spend on the elliptical $(E)$ and on the bike machine $(B)$ in a week to burn at least $2000$ calories.** 

[[☃ expression 1]]

**Graph the constraint equation with $E$ on the horizontal axis and $B$ on the vertical axis.** 

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

**If Dudley spends $2$ hours on the bike machine $(B)$, which of the following are numbers of hours he can spend on the elliptical trainer $(E)$ to meet or exceed his fitness goal?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]
